data.title: Welcome to President Nyerere of Tanganyika, 15 July 1963
data.meta_description: This folder contains a press copy of President John F. Kennedy's remarks of welcome to Mwalimu Julius K. Nyerere, President of the Republic of Tanganyika (later known as Tanzania), on the South Lawn of the White House. In his speech President Kennedy discusses the difficulties of building a cohesive society after independence from foreign rule has been achieved. The press copy also includes President Nyerere's response.
data.meta_site_name: John F. Kennedy Presidential Library and Museum
data.text:
About Folder

Title

Welcome to President Nyerere of Tanganyika, 15 July 1963

Collection

Papers of John F. Kennedy. Presidential Papers. President's Office Files.

Finding Aid | Digitized Content

Digital Identifier

JFKPOF-046-004

Folder Description

This folder contains a press copy of President John F. Kennedy's remarks of welcome to Mwalimu Julius K. Nyerere, President of the Republic of Tanganyika (later known as Tanzania), on the South Lawn of the White House. In his speech President Kennedy discusses the difficulties of building a cohesive society after independence from foreign rule has been achieved. The press copy also includes President Nyerere's response.

Extent / Physical Description

2 digital pages

Series

Series 03. Speech Files.

Preferred Citation

Papers of John F. Kennedy. Presidential Papers. President's Office Files. Speech Files. Welcome to President Nyerere of Tanganyika, 15 July 1963

Subject(s)

Place(s)

Contributor(s)

Nyerere, Julius K. (Julius Kambarage), 1922-1999

Media Type
